EmailTemplate.name: LE-02-09-202202-HHS-HAC-SEVT-INTERN'L-STROKE-CONF.-2022.Invite 1
EmailTemplate.subject: See what's new in virtual care at the International Stroke Conference
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
JOIN US International Stroke Conference
Feb 9-11, 2022 New Orleans, LA
Less than 30% of U.S. stroke patients experience a door-to-needle time less than one hour 1—telestroke programs can achieve an average response time of 2 minutes and 15 seconds 2. More than just videoconferencing, Teladoc Health offers a comprehensive stroke solution—from the ambulance to the hospital and beyond—to ensure better outcomes.
Visit our booth to learn how Teladoc Health can help extend the regional presence of stroke centers to increase access to specialized care. Visit booth 311 https://calendly.com/teladoc-health-hospital-and-health-systems/-at-isc?month=2022-02 1 Gregg C. Fonarow, MD. “Improving Outcomes in Acute Ischemic Stroke.” JAMA, American Medical Association, 23 Apr. 2014 2 Providence St. Joseph Health case study. https://teladochealth.com/resources/case-study/developing-a-system-wide-telestroke-network About Teladoc Health: Teladoc Health is transforming the healthcare experience and empowering people everywhere to live healthier lives. Recognized as the world leader in whole-person virtual care, Teladoc Health leverages more than a decade of expertise and data-driven insights to meet the growing virtual care needs of consumers and healthcare professionals.
Unsubscribe https://go1.teladochealth.com/subscriptions.html
